greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of q*(phi(-q)psi(q^4))^2 in powers of q where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) := Product_{k>=1} (1-(-q)^k) (see A121373), phi(q) := theta_3(q) := Sum_{k=-oo..oo} q^(k^2) (A000122), psi(q) := Sum_{k>=0} q^(k*(k+1)/2) (A010054), chi(q) := Product_{k>=0} (1+q^(2k+1)) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
M. D. Hirschhorn, J. A. Sellers, A Congruence Modulo 3 for Partitions into Distinct Non-Multiples of Four, Article 14.9.6, Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 17 (2014).
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of (eta(q)eta(q^8))^4/(eta(q^2)eta(q^4))^2 in powers of q.
Multiplicative with a(2)=-4, a(2^e)=0 if e>1, a(p^e)=(p^(e+1)-1)/(p-1) if p>2.
G.f. is Fourier series of a weight 2 level 8 cusp form. f(-1/ (8 t)) = -8 t^2 f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t).
mathematica: a[n_]:= SeriesCoefficient[(EllipticTheta[2, 0, q^2] *EllipticTheta[3, 0, -q])^2/4, {q, 0, n}]; Table[a[n], {n,0,50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 04 2018 *)
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jul 30 2006, May 28 2007
